verses.text: Hear ye now what the \sc Lord\sc* saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, And let the hills hear thy voice.
Hear ye, O mountains, the \sc Lord’s\sc* controversy, And ye strong foundations of the earth: For the \sc Lord\sc* hath a controversy with his people, And he will plead with Israel.
O my people, what have I done unto thee? And wherein have I wearied thee? Testify against me.
For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, And redeemed thee out of the house of servants; And I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, And what Balaam the son of Beor answered him; From Shittim unto Gilgal; That \add ye\add* may know the righteousness of the \sc Lord\sc*.
Wherewith shall I come before the \sc Lord\sc*, \add And\add* bow myself before the high God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, With calves of a year old?

Will the \sc Lord\sc* be pleased with thousands of rams, \add Or\add* with ten thousands of rivers of oil? Shall I give my firstborn \add for\add* my transgression, The fruit of my body \add for\add* the sin of my soul?
He hath shewed thee, O man, what \add is\add* good; And what doth the \sc Lord\sc* require of thee, But to do justly, and to love mercy, And to walk humbly with thy God?
The \sc Lord’s\sc* voice crieth unto the city, And \add the man of\add* wisdom shall see thy name: Hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.
Are there yet the treasures of wickedness \add in\add* the house of the wicked, And the scant measure \add that is\add* abominable?
Shall I count \add them\add* pure with the wicked balances, And with the bag of deceitful weights?
For the rich \add men\add* thereof are full \add of\add* violence, And the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, And their tongue \add is\add* deceitful in their mouth.
Therefore also will I make \add thee\add* sick in smiting thee, In making \add thee\add* desolate because of thy sins.

Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; And thy casting down \add shall be\add* in the midst of thee; And thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; And \add that\add* which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.
Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; Thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint \add thee with\add* oil; And sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.

For the statutes of Omri are kept, And all the works of the house of Ahab, And ye walk in their counsels; That I should make thee a desolation, And the inhabitants thereof a hissing: Therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
